dublin_core.dcvalue: Panel Integrating Digital and Non Digital Tools Many skilled birth attendants in low and middle income countries do not have the skills and knowledge of essential medical interventions or signal functions to provide quality basic emergency obstetric and neonatal care BEmONC This session will demonstrate how to integrate digital and non digital tools with proven best practices in BEmONC capacity building approaches Panelists will feature a variety of tools for supporting health worker training and BEmONC implementation Presented by Jennifer Breads Technical Advisor JhpiegoTara Talvacchia mHealth Manager Maternity FoundationAnne Marie Frokjaer Barrie Head of Development Programs Maternity FoundationCarolyn Moore Acting Director mPowering Frontline Health Workers
Basic Emergency Obstetric and Newborn Care (BEmONC) Learning
